1427436429148397569.text: He must use the threat of our military to make sure every American and deserving Afghan escapes the country, and the sober reality is that we will need more troops beyond just the airport to guarantee that happens.

1427436425742536709.text:
With the current mission posture that President Biden has decided on, there will be huge numbers of deserving Afghans left behind. They will be doomed to whatever grim fate the Taliban will hand them. 
 
President Biden cannot double down on this catastrophe of an exit.

1427436421921509382.text: What will happen to them if they cannot make it to the Kabul airport? And what about the tens of thousands of civil society activists, journalists, and women leaders whom the Administration has separately promised to evacuate?

1427436419446939649.text: President Biden said in his address that about 2000 SIV applicants and their families have made it out of Afghanistan thus far. But there is an estimated 50,000 to 80,000 additional SIV applicants, including their families, still in Afghanistan.

1427436417190408200.text: It has been reported that the Taliban knows the identities of these interpreters, as well as others who helped the US coalition, and is actively hunting them. If these individuals try to reach the airport, they are endangering their and their families’ lives.

1427436414648688642.text: This applies to countless Americans whose whereabouts are unknown, but especially to the thousands of SIV applicants, such as interpreters and their families, who cannot reach Kabul.

1427436412232773632.text: That means that the US military cannot actually ensure the safety of Americans or Afghans trying to make their way from outside Kabul into the city and to the airport for evacuation.

1427436409875582978.text: By all accounts the single, solitary place where US troops are located in Afghanistan is the Kabul airport.

1427436407279194112.text: He continues to assert that the current US mission is to ensure the safe evacuation of Americans and deserving Afghans from the Kabul airport. If only reality matched his words.

1427436403953176577.text: President Biden is failing in this moment. I pray that he finds the courage to change direction at the soonest possible moment.

1427053192286720002.text: It’s incumbent upon the United States to ensure a swift and safe evacuation of American citizens, along with our Afghan partners fleeing the Taliban.

1427053189933813782.text: The miscalculation to rapidly withdraw our forces to meet symbolic rather than strategic deadlines has created a rapidly unfolding humanitarian disaster that will lead to only more pain and suffering for the people of Afghanistan.

1427053185517109251.text: What we are witnessing in Afghanistan is nothing short of a tragedy.

1423731816943562759.text:
The first principle here should be: DO NO HARM.

The Warner-Portman-Sinema amendment will drive developers to create software outside of the U.S.

I urge my colleagues to oppose it and join me, @RonWyden, and @SenLummis in protecting American innovation.

1423731815739691017.text:
Now isn’t the time for the IRS to pick winners and losers with a new technology. 

Crypto has the potential to be the future of the internet. 

How foolish to crush it over a tax provision that possibly raises just $500 million per year more in a $1.2 TRILLION bill.

1423731814556917771.text:
We can all agree that centralized exchanges should be subject to the reporting requirement included in this bill, just like brokers would be subject to report other assets.

But why rush and get it wrong?

1423731813139238915.text:
.@USTreasury wants maximum flexibility to regulate and tax crypto as they see fit. Congress should not allow that to happen.

We need to have this debate in public and in full, especially before potentially disruptive changes are made that push crypto overseas.

1423731812292079621.text:
The Warner-Portman plan exempts bitcoin miners, but not other transaction validators or software developers who create these platforms.

What does that mean? Two identical services could receive dramatically different regulatory treatment depending on the technology used.

1423731811096670215.text: While I appreciate that my colleagues and the White House have acknowledged their original crypto tax had flaws, the Warner-Portman amendment picks winners and losers based on the type of technology employed. That’s horrible for innovation.

1423381112248754189.text: Speaking on the floor now about our bipartisan amendment. https://t.co/dklf7txuH2

1405268606112342016.text: When you subordinate the price stability mandate to try and maximize employment, you run the risk of failing on both fronts because you need stable prices to achieve a strong economy.

1405268602920439809.text: It is clear the labor market, which cannot be micromanaged by the Fed, is being held back by policymakers. It is not the Fed’s job to attempt to offset flawed unemployment policy at the expense of its price stability mandate.

1405268600173125637.text: With more job openings than people looking for work, the economy could quickly move a long way toward full employment if the Biden administration and congressional Democrats did not insist on paying people more in unemployment benefits than they make working.

1405268598306742275.text: Today’s announcement shows the Fed is continuing to prioritize maximum employment over controlling inflation.

1360711382975537153.text: He urged the mob to march on the Capitol for the explicit purpose of preventing Congress and the Vice President from formally certifying the results of the presidential election. All of this to hold on to power despite having legitimately lost.

1360711381016797197.text: His lawful, but unsuccessful, legal challenges failed due to lack of evidence. Then, he applied intense pressure on state and local officials to reverse the election outcomes in their states.

1360711380006039555.text: However, these facts do not make President Trump’s conduct in response to losing the 2020 election acceptable. He began with dishonest, systematic attempts to convince supporters that he had won.

1329550962806169600.text: stabilizing credit markets so private credit could once again flow to businesses, states, and municipalities.

1179070993907748864.text: For these reasons and more, it is important that the United States and free societies around the world support the people of Hong Kong, who are making an unprecedented stand against Xi’s repressive tactics.

1179070992783745025.text: And now we're seeing the erosion of what little economic freedom existed. A foreign policy priority of Xi’s authoritarian regime is to consolidate power throughout the Asia Pacific region. The Orwellian surveillance state constructed by Xi should give everyone pause.

1179070991802273793.text: Under Xi, many of Deng’s reforms have been rolled back. Human rights violations are systemic. Religious minorities like Uighur Muslims are imprisoned, and the state seeks to erase their way of life. Where's Tibet today?

1179070990334255105.text: Greater support for global investment and free markets raised the standard of living in China. Some religious freedom was tolerated. That being said, the Deng regime regularly violated human rights – most notably the horrific massacre at Tiananmen Square.

1179070988903993344.text: Following Mao’s death, and the unimaginable social trauma unleashed by his Cultural Revolution, there was hope with the ascension of Deng whose economic and social reforms were positives.

1179070987842838529.text: It started with Mao, whose oppressive, autocratic regime murdered tens of millions, seized and redistributed personal property, & mandated economic activities that led to the Great Chinese Famine.

1179070986865516544.text: The 70th anniversary of communist rule in China is not a day for celebration. It’s a day to remind ourselves of the horrors inflicted on the Chinese people over this time.

1164289402828394496.text: Congress can act to make our communities safer. The Manchin-Toomey bill to expand background checks to all commercial firearm sales is a good place to start. I stand ready to work with any member of Congress and @RealDonaldTrump to make this happen.

1164289401721106439.text: In 2012, a domestic abuser shot & killed 3 women in Brookfield, WI, including his wife. He wounded 4 others, including a pregnant woman. The shooter, who bought the gun online w/o a background check, was prohibited from having a gun b/c of a domestic violence restraining order.

1164289399045144581.text: In 2014, a convicted felon shot & killed 4 people in Monongalia Co., WV, including his ex-girlfriend & her boyfriend. The shooter, who bought the gun online w/o a background check, was prohibited from having a gun b/c of a felony kidnapping conviction.

1164289397954662400.text: In 2015, a convicted felon shot & killed 8 people in Harris Co., TX: his ex-girlfriend, her husband & her 6 children. The shooter, who bought the gun online w/o a background check, was prohibited from having a gun b/c he was a convicted felon who’d spent nearly 12 yrs in prison.

1164289396872482817.text: There’s no logical reason why you must have a background check to buy from a retailer, but not online or at a gun show. The Manchin-Toomey background check bill will save lives. Had it been law, these mass shootings may never have occurred:

1164289395601616897.text: I have spoken w/ the president directly and my staff and I have talked with the White House regularly over the past 2 weeks about extending background checks to cover all commercial firearm sales to keep guns out of the hands of violent criminals and the dangerously mentally ill.

1164289393944879104.text: Very encouraged to hear @RealDonaldTrump say today: “We're going to be doing background checks. We’re working with Democrats. We’re working with Republicans. We already have very strong background checks, but we're going to be filling in some of the loopholes.”

1162049961770569728.text: We can do more to strengthen our gun safety laws and better protect law enforcement. When Congress reconvenes, these issues, such as strengthening background checks to keep guns out of the hands of violent criminals, should be a top priority.

1162049960302567424.text: In the coming weeks, more information will hopefully come to light on how the suspect obtained his weapons, and I have asked ATF and the Department of Justice to keep me apprised of any new information.

1162049959274917889.text: The shooter who attempted to murder brave Philadelphia police officers yesterday is a convicted felon who had no right to possess a firearm.

1159836025574662148.text: President @realDonaldTrump is spot on. Background checks will help to keep guns out of the hands of violent criminals & the dangerously mentally ill. @Sen_JoeManchin's & my bill does just that, while protecting the 2nd Amdt. rights of law abiding citizens. Let's get this done. https://t.co/XPcGExtI4n

1159124064759418881.text: Encouraging remarks from @realDonaldTrump this AM. @Sen_JoeManchin & I are working w/ colleagues & the White House to pass our bipartisan bill that will extend background checks to better keep guns away from felons/mentally ill while protecting 2A rights of law abiding citizens. https://t.co/xHNMach8Z3

1158764108721922048.text: In addition to expanding the scope of background checks, Congress should promptly pass the bipartisan NICS Denial Notification Act to ensure that state and local law enforcement are notified when someone prohibited from purchasing a gun attempts to do so.

1158764107266498560.text: .@ChrisCoons and I agree the only way to make necessary progress on improving the nation’s gun safety laws is through bipartisan action. Strengthening our firearm background check system is an area where this is possible.

1158444104428269575.text: 3/3 Mass shootings and violent gun crimes are tragic American problems. It is past time for Congress to take action and the Manchin-Toomey background check legislation represents an opportunity to make actual bipartisan progress to help keep Americans safe.

1158444103476158466.text: 2/3 ...while respecting the Second Amendment rights of law-abiding gun owners and all Americans. The president showed a willingness to work with us on the issue of strengthening background checks.

1158444102456938496.text: 1/3 This morning, @Sen_JoeManchin and I separately discussed with @realDonaldTrump our support for passing our bipartisan legislation to strengthen background checks to keep guns out of the hands of criminals, the dangerously mentally ill, and terrorists...

1158046935053406208.text: I also agree with Senator Lindsey Graham that we should pass a bipartisan “red flag” measure that enables families and law enforcement to obtain a court order to keep guns away from dangerous individuals."

1158046934009024519.text: While no law will end mass shootings entirely, it's time for Congress to act to help keep our communities safer. We should start by passing bipartisan proposals such as my legislation with Senator Joe Manchin to expand background checks to all commercial firearm sales.

1118915387675033600.text: I appreciate Attorney General Barr agreeing to testify before Congress in public next month to discuss the report. The Special Counsel’s findings are a stark reminder that Russia’s goal is to undermine the trust the American people have in our democratic process and government.

1118915386693627911.text: I am pleased that the report does not have any redactions based on executive privilege and that a version of the report with all redactions removed, except those relating to grand jury information, will be made available to a bipartisan group of lawmakers.

1118915385615630336.text: While I have not had the opportunity to review the just-released 448 page report, all Americans should be pleased that the Special Counsel concluded there was no collusion between the Trump campaign and Russia.

1118915384676167681.text: I’ve repeatedly stated that Attorney General Barr should be as transparent as possible about the Special Counsel’s findings while being consistent with the law and longstanding Department of Justice policy.

1106274286459850752.text: But when I disagree with the president, I feel a responsibility to stand up and say so. For these reasons, I joined a bipartisan majority of my colleagues in voting to terminate the president’s national emergency declaration.

1106274285411319808.text: I backed his $5.7 billion request to build 234 miles of physical barriers at the ten most critical locations as determined by our border patrol, and voted last year for $25 billion in border security, including $18 billion specifically to build a physical barrier.

1106274284018851841.text: I have supported, and will continue to support, the president’s sensible efforts to secure the southern border.

1106274283075108864.text: The president’s emergency declaration undermines the fundamental constitutional principle of the separation of powers, and it sets a dangerous precedent that future presidents could use to advance controversial policies.

1106274282194255872.text: Well before the president declared this national emergency, I made clear that such a declaration was ill-advised. Our Constitution explicitly gives Congress the responsibility to determine how taxpayer money is used.

1088896369824280577.text: I hope Democrats, who promised to negotiate in good faith if the government were open, will now compromise with the president so the country can put this frustrating episode behind us.

1088896368448540672.text: As I have said all along, the obvious, necessary resolution is a compromise that improves border security – including physical barriers where they make sense – and delivers on some Democrat priorities, too.

1088896367194460160.text: I am glad the government is reopening and 800,000 federal employees are getting paid. Over the next three weeks, the president and Congress will have an opportunity to craft a workable solution.

1088570005820788739.text: I hope today’s votes will bring Speaker Pelosi and Democrats to the table so there is an agreement that reopens the government, secures the border, and allows federal employees to return to work with pay.

1088570004356907010.text: Speaker Pelosi has, thus far, refused to negotiate and my Democratic colleagues, just today, went so far as to block efforts to pay Coast Guard members and other federal employees who have been working without pay.

1088570003400675328.text: In a compromise, neither side gets everything they want and both sides get something they want. There is a deal to be had here that improves border security - including physical barriers where they make sense - and delivers on some Democrat priorities, too.

1088570001999740928.text: As I have said all along, the obvious, necessary resolution is a compromise. I am willing to compromise. In a compromise, neither side gets everything they want and both sides get something they want. I am willing to compromise.

1088570001114714114.text: I hope today’s votes represent modest progress toward ending this partial government shutdown. These votes demonstrate that neither the president’s proposal nor the Democrat proposal have enough support to pass Congress.

963880369937371136.text: Tune into C-SPAN 2 at 4PM to hear my address to the Senate on why we must pass my #SanctuaryCities amendment to protect communities from dangerous criminals.

963848296392470529.text: Thank you @SenTedCruz, @JimInhofe, @SenJohnBarrasso, @SenDeanHeller, @SenJohnKennedy, @Sen_JoeManchin, and @SenCapito for cosponsoring my bipartisan #SanctuaryCities amendment to keep our communities safe from dangerous criminals.

963795780799737856.text: Below is more information on the amendment that I introduced: https://t.co/USIhg9aNWB

963795779298185216.text: This isn’t a controversial issue. Leaders from both sides of the aisle agree that #SanctuaryCities policies must end. When I intro'd my bill in 2016, a bipartisan majority of the Senate voted in favor of it. It's time for this madness to end. Let's vote.

963795777813348353.text: In order for any #DACA fix to be meaningful and effective, we can't tie the hands of those who try to enforce the laws we write. #SanctuaryCity policies make it virtually impossible for any #DACA fix to be implemented in good faith. Worse still, they make us less safe.

963795776504770561.text: Immigrants want safe cities and communities as much as anyone. My amendment allows cities to protect illegal immigrants who come forward as witnesses or victims of crimes. This is about everyone’s safety.

963795774923526144.text: .@SenSchumer says #SanctuaryCities have nothing to do w/border security or #DACA. My #SanctuaryCities amdt focuses on smart immigration enforcement. Following immigration laws & protecting citizens from dangerous criminals in our cities is the 1st step to a secure border.

963795773107339264.text: I hope @SenSchumer and Senate Dems will agree to start holding votes on immigration since they've insisted upon debating it for weeks. First they shut down the government over this, now they’re slow-walking a start to the debate.

963547883642421254.text: Below is more information on the amendment that I Introduced today: https://t.co/USIhg9aNWB

963546152821026816.text: Enough playing politics with the safety and well-being of the American people. I ask my colleagues to join me in saying no more to #SanctuaryCities. Let’s make these dangerous policies a thing of the past.

963546151319474178.text: Leaders from both sides of the aisle agree: we must end the indefensible policy of protecting dangerous criminals from deportation. #SanctuaryCities do not protect the innocent, they simply make it harder to get violent criminals off the streets.

963546149801070592.text: Other than in enforcing immigration law, there is no other type of crime where a politician-made mandate ties local police hands when an officer thinks – in the interest of public safety – cooperation w/fed. law enforcement is necessary.

963546147917836288.text: Immigrants want safe streets, too, and the bill has language to protect those here illegally who come forward as a victim or witness of a crime.

963546146353352704.text: This isn’t about asking local police to enforce fed. immigration law. Fed. immigration officials are merely asking police to hold a person – who’s already been arrested and is in the US illegally – until DHS/ICE can arrive to question or take custody.

963546144898011136.text: #SanctuaryCity policies aren’t just unique to Philly. Many of Pennsylvania’s 67 counties have #SanctuaryCity policies. These laws are as misguided as they are dangerous.

963546143434137600.text: Philly's extreme + dangerous #SanctuaryCity law prohibited the police from even talking with federal immigration authorities. This wouldn't have happened if Philly wasn't a #SanctuaryCity.

963546141949415424.text: For example: Philly PD once arrested an illegal immigrant, who’d previously been deported, for assault & other charges. Fed. immigration officials asked Philly PD to hold him temporarily. Instead, the man was set free. He was later arrested for raping a child under the age of 13.

963546140472901634.text: #SanctuaryCities are jurisdictions/municipalities, like Philly, that have policies barring local law enf. from cooperating with fed. immigration authorities in certain instances, even in cases when they wanted to help. These policies hamper law enf. & make us less safe.

963546139009175552.text: I once again ask my colleagues to focus their attention on the serious problem of dangerous #SanctuaryCities. There's lots of misinformation about #SanctuaryCities so here are the facts.

963546137562107904.text: For there to be a good-faith bill on #DACA, dangerous #SanctuaryCity policies must be addressed: DREAM Act says if you commit certain crimes, you lose protections & can be deported. If local law enf. can’t cooperate with DHS/ICE, then this provision is virtually unenforceable.

963546136165343232.text: As we begin to debate the issue of immigration, @SenSchumer is blocking a vote on my amdt to address problem of dangerous #SanctuaryCities, putting interests of criminals before public safety.
